intro: Stylocoryna elliptica, commonly known as the elliptic stylocoryna, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its elliptical leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
